DOC.detailed_description: Study population Adults age ≥ 60 year essential hypertension recruit nursing home physical activity group state Colima , México . 45 subject assessed eligibility out-patient clinic . We exclude subject impaired renal hepatic function ; also subject treated vitamin D within last three month . None hormone replacement therapy , include subject anti-hypertensive 10 year dosages unchanged study . Before randomization , two subject withdraw informed consent personal reason , two subject exclude due diagnosis severe hypertension . Design The design double-blind , placebo control randomized clinical trial . The participant randomly assign use computer-generated randomization code two group : group 1 ( calcitriol group ) 22 subject enrol 6 week treatment daily dose 1000 IU cholecalciferol ( administer 1 capsule 25 μg ) group 2 23 subject ( control group ) receive similar placebo tablet also 6 week . During treatment , nine subject ( 20 % ) leave trial due personal reason . All patient provide write informed consent . The study conduct accordance Declaration Helsinki II guidance Good Clinical Practice ( GCP ) . Approval obtain bioethics committee Faculty Medicine University Colima ( FM014/2012 ) . Measurement At screen visit prior randomization , subject routine clinical examination data concern medical history . BP measure 3 consecutive day time , use kit integrate aneroid sphygmomanometer stethoscope ( medimetrics 5769 ) patient seat least 5 min rest . The subject average BP > 140/90 mm Hg include study . Once enrol study group , anthropometrics measurement collect . The measurement perform weight height light clothing shoe , indicator body mass index ( kg/m2 ) calculate . For determination serum 25 ( OH ) D , two blood sample collect morning overnight fast minimum 8 h day randomization end study . The patient attend control visit every week safety measure , adverse event registration assessment compliance.Returned pill count visit , compliance calculate percentage use pill compare expected number .
